message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.MM, cs.GR 

Reasoning: 
- cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) is the most likely category as the paper focuses on the comfort of viewers in stereoscopic displays and proposes an EEG-based method to assess it. 
- cs.CV (Computer Vision) is also likely as stereoscopic displays involve the perception of depth and require computer vision techniques to generate the 3D images. 
- cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is relevant as the paper uses EEG to measure brain activity and analyze event-related potentials. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia) is relevant as the paper deals with the presentation of multimedia content (stereoscopic displays) and proposes a method to improve the user experience. 
- cs.GR (Graphics) is also relevant as the paper deals with the generation and display of 3D graphics in stereoscopic displays.
